title: [K-12] Mobile-Based Language-Linguistic Intelligence Utilization Program for Socio-Cultural Text Interpretation and Civic Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency, digital tool competency, foundational understanding of social phenomena, and preliminary knowledge of historical/geographical contexts
context.additional_context: Smartphone-centric learning environment with 3–5 weekly mobile platform logins and 15–20 minute learning modules. Emphasis on activities using socio-cultural texts (news articles, reports, policy documents). Includes discussion and collaborative tasks to foster learners' civic consciousness.

learning_goals: Learners will improve their ability to interpret socio-cultural texts and express critical perspectives by over 30% through language-linguistic intelligence enhancement activities over four weeks, while developing analytical skills that consider historical context and cultural diversity

Learners will independently perform and certify language reasoning activities related to social issues at least three times weekly via a mobile platform, expanding awareness of civic rights and responsibilities

Learners will extract at least five core concepts from three given socio-cultural texts using mind maps and keyword-linking tools, write a one-page interpretive report explaining intertextual connections, and strengthen their ability to analyze social relationships based on this

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
